com.avaje.ebean.dbmigration.ddlgeneration.platform

Class BaseTableDdl

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.avaje.ebean.dbmigration.ddlgeneration.platform.BaseTableDdl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    TableDdl

    public class BaseTableDdl
extends Object
implements TableDdl
    Base implementation for 'create table' and 'alter table' statements.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected int countCheck 
      protected int countForeignKey 
      protected int countIndex 
      protected int countUnique 
      protected List<Column> externalUnique
      Used when unique constraints specifically for OneToOne can't be created normally (MsSqlServer).
      protected String historyTableSuffix 
      protected IndexSet indexSet
      Used to check that indexes on foreign keys should be skipped as a unique index on the columns already exists.
      protected DbConstraintNaming naming 
      protected NamingConvention namingConvention 
      protected PlatformDdl platformDdl 
      protected Map<String,HistoryTableUpdate> regenerateHistoryTriggers
      Base tables that have associated history tables that need their triggers/functions regenerated as columns have been added, removed, included or excluded.

      BaseTableDdl(ServerConfig serverConfig, PlatformDdl platformDdl)
      Construct with a naming convention and platform specific DDL.

        protected void writeUniqueOneToOneConstraints(DdlWrite write,
                                              CreateTable createTable)
                                       throws IOException

      • lowerName

        protected String lowerName(String name)
        Convert the table or column name to lower case.

        This is passed up to the platformDdl to override as desired. Generally lower case with underscore is a good cross database choice for column/table names.

      • determinePrimaryKeyColumns

        protected List<Column> determinePrimaryKeyColumns(List<Column> columns)
        Return the list of columns that make the primary key.
